docs.lead_paragraph: WHAT the federal government giveth, it can also taketh away. When Congress passed its overhaul of Medicare last year, which included a spanking new prescription drug benefit for the elderly, it promised more money to hospitals and health plans, too. But there are already rumblings about restraining some of the legislation's generosity, as its estimated price tag has risen to $500 billion plus over the next decade.

headline.main: THE MARKETS: Market Place; A murky outlook for health-related stocks on fears that the Medicare overhaul may be overhauled.

docs.abstract: Stock analysts and investors are concerned that health care companies most affected by Medicare legislation may see efforts in Congress to trim Medicare spending after November elections; say that it will not become clear until after elections which kinds of health care companies are likely to face lower reimbursements; graph (M)
